span.p: View this page for resources and information regarding our COVID-19 Closure: https://www.rossfordschools.org/COVID-19ResourcePage.aspx

p.span: In light of Governor DeWine’s recent order for schools to continue remote learning through the remainder of this school year we wanted to share information on remote learning.

Content is available to students by logging into their “Clever” online accounts. Once students log into Clever, they will be able to access each teacher’s learning platform by clicking on the teacher’s class link at the top of the page. Those links will point to Google Classroom, PowerSchool Learning or another platform that the teacher is using to deliver instruction. Teachers will also schedule online class meetings to give students an opportunity to interact with peers and engage in discussion.

Assignments will be posted on Friday mornings and due the following Thursday. Assignments are required and will be graded. Because third quarter was still in progress when the Governor ordered the closure, the grading period from third quarter will be extended through the end of the year. Third and fourth quarters will be combined into one second semester grade.
We know this brings many questions. We created a

here that will answer questions on how to log into clever, a schedule for assignments, how the grading will work, and more. If you have any follow up questions please contact your building administrator (Rossford Junior Senior High School, [email protected] and Rossford Elementary School, [email protected])

We, along with our teachers, are excited for education to resume. We understand that families are experiencing unique challenges and your child may have circumstances which will require additional flexibility. If your family experiences a situation that interferes with your child’s ability to complete the assigned remote learning activities, please email his/her principal so that we may work with you.
Thank you for your continued support.
Jeff Taylor, Rossford Elementary School Principal
Tony Brashear, Rossford Junior-Senior High School Principal

a.onclick: ga('send', 'event', 'URL', 'Link', 'Family Activities to do during COVID-19');

div.a: Family Activities to do during COVID-19

div.span: Free, monthly home-book deliver for children ages 0-5.
The 'Doghouse' Rossford Strength Training. Rossford graduate and football coach Sam Beale is helping our PE classes and athletes during this quarantine with home workouts to do. Thanks Sam!

span.p: Meals will be served at Brentwood Park (300 Brentwood Drive, Northwood) at 11 a.m. Monday, April 20 and April 27 with four lunches being given out for the rest of the week.
This is for any children ages from 1 year to 18 years of age.
Our Rossford Schools families are welcome to come and pick up meals for their children at this distribution. Again we are so grateful for our partnership with Northwood Schools.
CedarCreek Church is also making appointments for food bags for local families in need. Email [email protected] to set up an appointment.

div.span: Our playgrounds and courts are closed to the public in conjuction with the Rossford Police Department's closure to keep good social distancing.
